question_text: Which of these would you say is more important in preparing children for life? To be obedient or To think for themselves
comments: Question not repeated - no issp topic

question_text: Private enterprise is the best way to solve [Country's] economic problems
It is the responsibility of the government to reduce the differences in income between people with high incomes and those with low incomes

Looking at the list below, please tick a box next to the one thing you think should be [Country's] highest priority, the most important thing it should do. [Country] should [1] Maintain order in the nation, [2] Give people more say in government decisions, [3] Fight rising prices, [4] Protect freedom of speech

And which one do you think should be [Country's] next highest priority, the second most important thing it should do? [Country] should [1] Maintain order in the nation, [2] Give people more say in government decisions, [3] Fight rising prices, [4] Protect freedom of speech
We believe too often in science, and not enough in feelings and faith
Overall, modern science does more harm than good
Any change humans cause in nature - no matter how scientific - is likely to make things worse
comments: Question not repeated - no issp topic

question_text: Modern science will solve our environmental problems with little change to our way of life
new_class_comments: Unsure if this really indicates receptiveness to government climate action.

question_text: We worry too much about the future of the environment and not enough about prices and jobs today
comments: Asks about recession rather than prices and jobs in Japan, 1993

question_text: Almost everything we do in modern life harms the environment
new_class_comments: Unsure if this really indicates receptiveness to government climate action. Asbolutist claims, clarity of the question - some thing we do in modern life might be more protective of the environment than things done in the past.

question_text: Animals should have the same moral rights that human beings do
comments: Question not repeated - no issp topic

question_text: Human beings should respect nature because it was created by God
People worry too much about human progress harming the environment
Nature would be at peace and in harmony if only human beings would leave it alone
comments: Question not repeated - no issp topic

question_text: In order to protect the environment [Country] needs economic growth
It is right to use animals for medical testing if it might save human lives
Nature is really a fierce struggle for survival of the fittest
Economic growth always harms the environment
new_class_comments: Unsure if this really indicates receptiveness to government climate action. Levels of disagreement - strength of disagreement might indicate intolerance of absolutist statements rather than decreasing receptiveness to climate action.

question_text: Every time we use coal or oil or gas, we contribute to the greenhouse effect/climate change

question_text: In general, do you think that air pollution caused by cars is extremely dangerous for the environment, very dangerous, somewhat dangerous, not very dangerous, or not dangerous at all for the environment?
new_class_comments: This question asks about a specific environmental issues (although it also asks how much the specific relates to the environment in general) - so we classify as not about the environment in general.

question_text: And do you think that air pollution caused by cars is extremely dangerous for you and your family, very dangerous, somewhat dangerous, not very dangerous, or not dangerous at all for you and your family?
new_class_comments: This question asks about a specific environmental issues (although it also asks how much the specific relates to the environment in general) - so we classify as not about the environment in general.

question_text: If you had to choose, which one of the following would be closest to your views? Government should let ordinary people decide for themselves how to protect the environment, even if it means they don't always do the right thing. or Government should pass laws to make ordinary people protect the environment, even if it interferes with people's rights to make their own decisions

question_text: Generally speaking, how concerned are you about environmental issues?

Which problem, if any, do you think is the most important for [COUNTRY] as a whole? 1 Air pollution. 2 Chemicals and pesticides. 3 Water shortage. 4 Water pollution. 5 Nuclear waste. 6 Domestic waste disposal. 7 Climate change. 8 Genetically modified foods. 9 Using up our natural resources. 10 None of these
comments: Extra response category in South Korea: 11 = disorderly way of regional development
new_class_comments: Could be recoded so that the answer reports whether R thinks climate change is the biggest environmental issue facing the country.. Currently exclude because there are several responses that could indicate extensive climate concern but which are not the climate change category. (The examples would be air pollution, water shortage, using up our natural resources). We could reconsider this because  a recoded version of this question is  the second DV in the Anomolous Anglophones paper, so that would improve comparability.

question_text: Which problem, if any, affects you and your family the most? 1 Air pollution. 2 Chemicals and pesticides. 3 Water shortage. 4 Water pollution. 5 Nuclear waste. 6 Domestic waste disposal. 7 Climate change. 8 Genetically modified foods. 9 Using up our natural resources. 10 None of these
comments: 10 = noises in South Korea

question_text: I find it hard to know whether the way I live is helpful or harmful to the environment
Environmental problems have a direct effect on my everyday life
comments: Reversed but set to exclude
exclusion_reason: Not sure if this indicates environmental position
new_class_comments: Not a general environmental attitude - it is experience of an environmental problem.
